notfound: The page you're looking for doesn't exist.
api_paragraph: The API for this site is open and freely available, and is found at:
developers_code_paragraph: The code for both the frontend and the API is open. Find it at:
developers_code_paragraph2: Feel free to open Github Issues if you find any technical issues on the site, or on the API.
copyright: Copyright © Centre for Sámi language technology
feedback: Send feedback about the webpage to:
analyze_description: Analyze one or more words in isolation.
dependency_description: Show dependancies between words in sentences.
disambiguate_description: Show analyses that fits in the context of sentences.
generate_description: Generate words from from grammatical specifications.
paradigm_description: Generate paradigms of different sizes for any word.
paradigm_instruction: Search for words in their base form.
num_description: Generate words from numbers, times or dates.
transcribe_instruction: Write the words you want to transcribe below and submit.
usage_ciw: The analyser uses the Double Vowel (Fiero) system.
usage_crk: You may use both circumflex â and macron ā in order to mark long vowel.
usage_mns: Write the word in ordinary Mansi orthography. You may also write the words without length marks.
usage_sjd: Write the word in Kildin Sámi orthography. Note that we use Cyrillic Characters also for the Latin-looking ones. The program uses the 1985 orthography.
usage_sje: The program accepts both Norwegian æ and ø and Swedish ä and ö.
usage_sma: The program accepts both i and the South Sámi character ï and both Norwegian æ, ø and Swedish ä, ö
usage_sme: Write The Sámi special letters as usual. If you don't have a Sámi keyboard, you may write "á, č, đ, ŋ, š, ŧ, ž" as "a1, c1, d1, n1, s1, t1, z1".
usage_smj: You may use the ordinary Lule Sámi characters, the (official) ŋ, or older ń, ñ. The program accepts both Norwegian æ, ø and Swedish ä, ö.
usage_smn: Write the word in ordinary Inari Sámi orthography.
usage_sms: Write the word in ordinary Skolt Sámi orthography.
langmodellastupdated: The language model was last updated
place: Giellatekno, UiT The Arctic University of Norway

introduction_tool_analyze_lang_kal: Write or paste the words in the window, and press the "Send form" button. The options "Analyze" gives all possible analyses, whereas the (default) option "Disambiguate" gives only the analyses appropriate for the given sentence. The program may also hyphenate the text for you, or add syllable boundaries, in which case it will not give a grammatical analysis. Choose "Hyphenate".
introduction_tool_analyze_type_nodepende: Write or paste the words in the window, and press the "Analyze" or "Reset" button. The options "Analyze" gives all possible analyses, whereas the (default) option "Disambiguate" gives only the analyses appropriate for the given sentence. The program may also hyphenate the text for you, or add syllable boundaries, in which case it will not give a grammatical analysis. Choose "Hyphenate".
introduction_tool_analyze_type_nodisamb: Copy text into the window below, and the program will give you all possible morphological analyses of the wordforms in question.
introduction_tool_analyze_type_nohyph_la: Write or paste the words in the window, and press the "Send form" button. Note that the analyser still contains a handful of verbs.
introduction_tool_analyze_type_nohyph: Copy text into the window below, and the program will give you all possible morphological analyses of the wordforms in question. If you choose Disambiguate, it will make an attempt at choosing the analysis which suits the given context (warning: the development of the disambiguation program hasn't really started yet).
introduction_tool_analyze: Write or paste the words in the window, and press the "Analyze" or "Reset" button. The options "Analyze" gives all possible analyses, whereas the (default) option "Disambiguate" gives only the analyses appropriate for the given sentence. The program may also hyphenate the text for you, or add syllable boundaries, in which case it will not give a grammatical analysis. Choose "Hyphenate".
introduction_p2_tool_analyze_lang_ciw: Some of the verbs included so far are: anwebi, aadizooke, bangishino, biindige, bimaadizi, gaasikanaabaagawe, gashkendamo, giigoonyike, giiwe, izhaa, jiibaakwe, maajaa, minikwe, wiisini, minomaagwad, gozigwan. Some of the nouns are: inini, ikwe, makwa, mitig, aanakwad, zaaga'igan, miikana, ziibi, makak, abwi, baabaa, maamaa, gosis, daanis, mishoomis.
introduction_p2_tool_analyze_lang_crk: You may also convert text from the Latin alphabet to syllabics or vice versa. Choose "Latin letters to syllabics" or "Syllabics to Latin letters"
introduction_p2_tool_analyze_lang_ipk: You may also convert Iñupiaq text from the 8-bit IñupiaQ Dictionary encoding to Unicode (if your Iñupiaq text contains some of the letters e, f, x, b, you need to do this). Choose "Convert".
introduction_p2_emph: kra, i.e. "ĸ" (Unicode U+0138), but since some users may not have support for it, the conversion tool will translate non-initially written capital K as if it was kra. Choose "Convert".
introduction_tool_generate: Write the word and grammatical specification in the window, and press the "Generate" or "Reset" button.
introduction_tool_placenames: Write the place name in Sámi, Norwegian, Swedish or Finnish. If the answer contains a name in parentheses, then this name is the name of the municipality in question.  Our sources are Statens Kartverk (SK), Sámi Parliament in Sweden (SvSt), Pekka Sammallahti "Sámi-suoma sátnegirji" (PS) and Sámi Atlas by H.R. Mathisen (SA).
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_bxr: Write a Buriat word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm. The program only works for a couple of nouns.
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_ciw: Write an Ojibwe word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm. The program only works for a couple of verbs.
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_cor: Write a Cornish word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_fao: Write a Faroese word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_fin: The Finnish paradigm generator does not work yet.
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_fit: The Finnish paradigm generator does not work yet.
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_fkv: The Kven paradigm generator does not work yet.
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_ipk: Write a Inupiaq word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_kal: Write a Greenlandic word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_kpv: Впишите слова коми языка, и программа производит флективную парадигму
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_mhr: Write a Meadow Mari word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_mns: Write a Mansi word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_myv: Write a Erzya word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_rus: The Russian paradigm generator does not work yet.
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_sjd: Write a Kildin Sámi word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm. The program contains the words listed in the grammar appendix of Kuruch's dictionary.
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_sje: Write a Pite Sámi word and choose the part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm. Currently, the program contains most of the nouns and verbs found in the lexical database for Pite Sámi (saami.uni-freiburg.de/psdp/pite-lex), which is regularly corrected, expanded and improved. This database is based on thePitesamisk ordbok samt stavningsregler (Samica 2, 2016, edited by J. Wilbur), but also includes a few other words added by Ann-Charlotte Sjaggo. It is still under development.
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_sma: Write a South Sámi word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_sme: Write a North Sámi word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_smj: Write a Lule Sámi word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_smn: Write a Inari Sámi word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm. The program only contains the words in the appendix of Morottaja and Sammallahti, and it is still under development.
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_sms: Write a Skolt Sámi word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm. The program contains several thousand words from Itkonen, Moshnikoff, Sammallahti and modern social media. If you notice mistakes, please contact us at Giellatekno.
introduction_tool_paradigm_lang_udm: Write a Udmurt word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm. The program contains thousands of words from the dictionaries by Saarinen et al, for instance.
introduction_tool_paradigm: Skriv basisforma av ordet og vel ordklasse, og programmet vil generere heile paradigmet for ordet.
example_tool_generate_lang_cor: In order to get a Cornish wordform, write baseform+tags.
example_tool_generate_lang_crk: In order to get e.g. atimwak, writeatim+N+AN+Pl, and in order to getkiwicihikonaw, writewicih+V+TA+Ind+Prs+3Sg+12PlO
example_tool_generate_lang_fin: In order to get e.g. joella, writejoki+N+Sg+Ade
example_tool_generate_lang_fit: In order to get e.g. joela, writejoki+N+Sg+Ade
example_tool_generate_lang_fkv: In order to get e.g. jovella, writejoki+N+Sg+Ade
example_tool_generate_lang_ipk: In order to get e.g. iglum, writeiglu+N+Rel+Sg
example_tool_generate_lang_kal: In order to get e.g. illup, writeillu+N+Rel+Sg
example_tool_generate_lang_kpv: In order to get e.g. кывлы, writeкыв+N+Sg+Dat
example_tool_generate_lang_mhr: In order to get e.g. олмам, writeолма+N+Acc
example_tool_generate_lang_mns: In order to get e.g. улят, writeуля+N+Sg+Loc
example_tool_generate_lang_rus: In order to get e.g. тигров, writeтигр+N+Msc+Pl+Acc
example_tool_generate_lang_sme: In order to get e.g. viesus, writeviessu+N+Sg+Loc.
example_tool_generate_lang_smj: In order to get e.g. gádov, writegáhtot+V+Ind+Prs+Sg1. Forelluj andmuv, writeællo+N+Sg+Ill andmån+Pron+Pers+Sg1+Acc.
example_tool_generate_lang_sms: In order to get e.g. kuäʹđest, writekueʹtt+N+Sg+Loc.
example_tool_generate_lang_yrk: In order to get e.g. тэхэна, writeты+N+Sg+Loc
example_tool_generate: Write lemma + grammatical analysis in order to get the wordform.
instruction_tool_generate: Type the word form and grammatical code:
endtext: The program is under construction. If you notice errors of any kind, please report them to giellatekno@uit.no.
end_lang_sma: The program is under construction. If you notice errors of any kind, please report them to The Centre for Sámi language technology.
end_lang_smj: The Lule Sámi analysis program contains close to 20000 base forms (from Spiiks grammar, Nystø/Johnsens textbook Sámásta, and above all from Kintels and also Korhonens dictionaries), but much work still remains to be done. If you find errors or omissions, please report back to us in the Sámi language technology team.
end_lang_smn: The program is in a test phase and it, contains only some words from the grammar section of the Sammallahti - Morottaja dictionary. If you notice errors of any kind, please report them to The Centre for Sámi language technology.
end_lang_sms: The program contains several thousand words from Itkonen,  Moshnikoff, Sammallahti and modern social media.  If you notice errors of any kind, please report them to The Centre for Sámi language technology.
end_tool_analyze: The program is not finished. If you notice errouneous forms or analyses, please contact Giellatekno.
introduction_lang_crk: The Plains Cree tools represent work by AltLab at U of Alberta and Giellatekno at UiT.
introduction_lang_est: The Estonian analyser is just in the making.
introduction_lang_gle: The Irish analyser is just in the making.
introduction_lang_izh: The Ingrian analyser is just in the making.
introduction_lang_kca: The Khanty analyser is just in the making.
introduction_lang_liv: The Livonian analyser is just in the making.
introduction_lang_mdf: The Moksha analyser is just in the making.
introduction_lang_mrj: The Hill Mari analyser is just in the making.
introduction_lang_nio: The Nganasan analyser is just in the making.
introduction_lang_nob: The Norwegian Bokmål analyser is just in the making.
introduction_lang_olo: The Olonetsian analyser is just in the making.
introduction_lang_vep: The Veps analyser is just in the making.
introduction_lang_vro: The Võro analyser is just in the making.
introduction_lang_vot: The Votic analyser is just in the making.
introduction_lang_yrk: The Nenets analyser is just in the making.
introduction_lang_bxr: The Buriat analyser is just in the making.
introduction_lang_ciw: The Ojibwe analyser is just in the making.
introduction_lang_cor: This is the home page of the Cornish parser project. The project     is still in its embryonic phase. You will be able to analyse a     handful of words only, but we will enlarge the base     eventually. The parser is based upon the Single Written Form.
introduction_lang_fao: The Faroese tools combine a morphological and morphophonological transducer with the set of lexemes found in Føroysk orðabók into a grammatical parser for Faroese. The morphological coverage is quite good (with some lacunas for strong verbs and adjectives), but the syntactic analyser is in its infancy.
introduction_lang_fin: The Finnish analyser is just in the making.
introduction_lang_fit: The Meänkieli analyser is just in the making.
introduction_lang_ipk: This is the home page of the Iñupiaq parser project. The project is still in its embryonic phase. Our Iñupiaq analysers covers the basic inflectional grammar, and the central vocabulary (but very few derivational affixes!). We will enlarge the base eventually. We also offer a convertion from the Interactive IñupiaQ Dictionary encoding to Unicode.
introduction_p: A new version of the Greenlandic spell checker and hyphenation tools for the Windows version of the MSOffice suite (KUKKUNIIAAT ver. 2.0) is nowready for download. It is free of charge and can be downloadedhere.
introduction_lang_koi: The Komi Permyak analyser gives a morphological and syntactical analysis of most words in running text.
introduction_lang_kpv: The Komi analyser gives a morphological and syntactical analysis of most words in running text.
introduction_lang_mhr: The Meadow Mari analyser gives a morphological and syntactical analysis of most words in running text.
introduction_lang_mns: The Mansi analyser gives a morphological and syntactical analysis of most words in running text.
introduction_lang_myv: The Erzya analyser gives a morphological and syntactical analysis of most words in running text.
introduction_lang_rus: The Russian analyser gives a morphological and syntactical analysis of most words in running text.
introduction_lang_udm: The Udmurt analyser gives a morphological and syntactical analysis of most words in running text.
introduction_lang_sjd: The Kildin Sámi analyser only contains a handful of words yet. The     number generator works, though.
introduction_lang_sje: The Pite Sámi analyser and generator currently work for most of the nouns and verbs found in the lexical database for Pite Sámi (saami.uni-freiburg.de/psdp/pite-lex), which is regularly corrected, expanded and improved. This database is based on thePitesamisk ordbok samt stavningsregler (Samica 2, 2016, edited by J. Wilbur), but also includes a few other words added by Ann-Charlotte Sjaggo. The orthography used is based on the orthography presented atsaami.uni-freiburg.de/psdp/stavningsregler/. This is still a preliminary, test version, and is under on-going development.
introduction_lang_smj: For Lule Sámi, our morphological tools are quite robust. Analysing     words in context (disambiguation and syntax), however, is still in     the beginning.
introduction_lang_smn: The Inari Sámi analyser gives the morphological analysis of     over 92 % of the words in running text,     and gives a rough syntactic analysis of sentences.
introduction_lang_sms: The Skolt Sámi analyser gives the morphological analysis of     over 70 % of the words in running text, but work has not yet     started on syntactic analysis of sentences.
analysis_text_lang_izh: Analyse a handful of words only.
analysis_text_lang_kca: Analyse a handful of words only.
analysis_text_lang_liv: Analyse a handful of words only.
analysis_text_lang_mdf: Analyse a handful of words only.
analysis_text_lang_mrj: Analyse a handful of words only.
analysis_text_lang_nio: Analyse a handful of words only.
analysis_text_lang_olo: Analyse a handful of words only.
analysis_text_lang_vep: Analyse a handful of words only.
analysis_text_lang_yrk: Analyse a handful of words only.
analysis_text_lang_ipk: Analyse words (no syntactic analysis). You may paste in text, and the program gives all possible analyses for each wordform. You may also convert text from Interactive IñupiaQ Dictionary encoding to Unicode.
analysis_text_lang_kal: Analyse, disambiguate and hyphenate text. The program also gives     IPA representation, and it converts from Kleinschmidt (pre-1973)     to modern orthography.
analysis_text_lang_sjd: Analyse a handful of words only.
analysis_text_lang_sme: Analyse, disambiguate and hyphenate text, and give dependency     analysis. Convert text into IPA.
analysis_text_lang_crk: Analyses text. Converts text between latin letters and syllabics.
paradigm_text: Generates paradigms of different sizes for any word.
paradigm_text_lang_ipk: Generates paradigms of different sizes for the core vocabulary.
paradigm_text_lang_mns: Generates paradigms of different sizes for the core vocabulary.
paradigm_text_lang_sjd: The paradigm generator works formally, but the paradigms given often contain     more errors than correct forms. At the moment, the generator is on the     net for internal delvelopment purposes.
paradigm_text_lang_sje: Generates paradigms of different sizes for the core vocabulary.
paradigm_text_lang_smn: Generates paradigms of different sizes for adjectives, nouns and verbs.
paradigm_text_lang_sms: Generates paradigms of different sizes for adjectives, nouns and verbs.
generator_text: Generates wordforms using lemma and grammatical tags.
numerals_text: Write a number (ex. 123), and get a number word.
numerals_text_lang_hdn: Write a number (ex. 74), and get a number word.
numerals_text_lang_bxr: There is still no numeral generator for Buriat.
numerals_text_lang_ciw: There is still no numeral generator for Ojibwe.
numerals_text_lang_cor: There is still no numeral generator for Cornish.
numerals_text_lang_fao: There is still no numeral generator for Faroese.
numerals_text_lang_ipk: There is still no numeral generator for Iñupiaq.
numerals_text_lang_kal: There is still no numeral generator for Greenlandic.
numerals_text_lang_rus: There is still no numeral generator for
numerals_text_lang_sma: There is still no numeral generator for
numerals_text_lang_sme: There is still no numeral generator for
numerals_text_lang_smj: There is still no numeral generator for
numerals_text_lang_sjd: There is still no numeral generator for
numerals_text_lang_udm: There is still no numeral generator for Udmurt.
other_lang_crk: AltLab at U of Alberta and Giellatekno at UiT. AltLab work is financed by SSHRC Canada
other_lang_ipk: The project is a joint project between Grønlands Sprognævn (Oqaasileriffik) and the University of Tromsø.
other_lang_izh: The Ingrian tools represent work by Jack Rueter, in cooperation with Giellatekno. The work is financed by the Kone Foundation and the University of Tromsø
other_lang_kal: The project is a joint project between Grønlands Sprognævn (Oqaasileriffik) and the University of Tromsø.
other_lang_kca: The Khanty tools represent work by Jack Rueter, in cooperation with Giellatekno. The work is financed by the Kone Foundation and the University of Tromsø
other_lang_koi: The Komi Permyak tools are in the making. They represent a joint project between FU-lab, Giellatekno and Jack Rueter.
other_lang_kpv: The Komi tools are in the making. They represent a joint project between Giellatekno and Jack Rueter. The lexicon of the analysers are based upon Jack Rueter's Komi-Finnish-English dicionary.
other_lang_liv: The Livonian tools represent work by Renate Blumberga and Jack Rueter, in cooperation with Giellatekno. The work is financed by the Kone Foundation and the University of Tromsø
other_lang_mdf: The Moksha tools represent work by Eeva Herrala, Aleksandr Feoktistov, Merja Salo and Jack Rueter, in cooperation with Giellatekno. The present work is financed by the Kone Foundation and the University of Tromsø
other_lang_mhr: The Meadow Mari tools are in the making. They represent a joint project between Giellatekno and Jorma Luutonen. The lexicon of the analysers are based upon Arto Moisios Mari-Finnish dicionary.
other_lang_mrj: The Hill Mari tools represent work by Julia Kuprina and Jack Rueter, in cooperation with Giellatekno. The work is financed by the Kone Foundation and the University of Tromsø
other_lang_myv: The Erzya tools are in the making. They represent a joint project between Giellatekno and Jack Rueter. The lexicon of the analysers are based on dictionary work on Erzya by many authors.
other_lang_nio: The Nganasan tools represent work by Jack Rueter, in cooperation with Giellatekno. The work is financed by the Kone Foundation and the University of Tromsø
other_lang_olo: The Olonetsian tools represent work by Timo Rantakaulio and Jack Rueter, in cooperation with Giellatekno. The work is financed by the Kone Foundation and the University of Tromsø
other_lang_rmf: The work on the Finnish Romani tools has just started. The analysers are put here for testing purposes.
other_lang_sjd: The work on the Kildin Sámi tools has just started. The analysers are put here for testing purposes.
other_lang_sje: The Pite Sámi tools are available here for testing purposes, and without any guarantee for accuracy. These are currently under development by Joshua Wilbur (with significant technical support from Giellatekno) as part of a project on Pite Sámi syntactic structures at theFreiburg Research Group in Sámi Studies. Thanks to Ann-Charlotte Sjaggo and Trond Trosterud for setting up the initial framework.
other_lang_vep: The Veps tools represent work by Jack Rueter, in cooperation with Giellatekno. The work is financed by the Kone Foundation and the University of Tromsø
other_lang_yrk: The Nenets tools represent work by Tapani Salminen, Sven-Erik Soosaar and Jack Rueter, in cooperation with Giellatekno. The present work is financed by the Kone Foundation and the University of Tromsø
